cnbc.title: Trump suggests not all furloughed workers will get back pay: 'It depends'
cnbc.summary: Trump also said at the White House that if the shutdown drags on several days longer, a "substantial" number of jobs "will never come back."

cnbc.title: Gold prices keep rising, and jewelry companies are sounding the alarm
cnbc.summary: Some jewelry companies who aim to offer gold pieces at lower price points are beginning to sound the alarm on higher prices for the precious metal.

cnbc.title: Tesla prices Model Y standard below $40,000, debuting more affordable vehicle
cnbc.summary: Tesla's Model Y standard SUV is priced just under $40,000 and Model 3 standard sedan around $37,000.

cnbc.title: Michael Dell says 'at some point there'll be too many' AI data centers, but not yet
cnbc.summary: Dell Technologies CEO Michael Dell said that demand for AI computing power is "tremendous."

cnbc.title: Ray Dalio says today is like the early 1970s and investors should hold more gold than usual
cnbc.summary: "Gold is the only asset that somebody can hold and you don't have to depend on somebody else to pay you money for," Dalio said.

cnbc.title: Republicans face pressure to consider Democrats' health-care demands as shutdown drags on
cnbc.summary: Democrats have refused to vote for any funding legislation unless it includes an extension of Obamacare subsidies, which are due to expire before January.

cnbc.title: Billionaire tech investor Orlando Bravo says 'valuations in AI are at a bubble'
cnbc.summary: One key difference between the dot-com bubble and today, Bravo said, is that big companies with healthy balance sheets are financing tech startups.

cnbc.title: How the S&P 500 performed after 10 previous government shutdowns

cnbc.title: Gold price reaches $4,000 an ounce for the first time ever
cnbc.summary: Gold futures have gained more than 50% this year as the dollar has weakened and President Donald Trump threatens Federal Reserve independence.

cnbc.title: Furloughed federal workers face threat of no back pay from shutdown, despite 2019 law requiring it
cnbc.summary: As the federal shutdown stretches on, furloughed federal workers face the threat of not receiving back pay, despite a 2019 law that requires it.
